text: The Milvian (or Mulvian) Bridge is a bridge over the Tiber River in northern Rome, Italy. The bridge was built in 109 BC, meaning it goes back to antiquity, or ancient times. The bridge is also notable for the Battle of the Milvian Bridge, which happened in the year 312. Category:Bridges in Italy Category:Buildings and structures in Rome Category:2nd-century BC buildings and structures
title: Milvian bridge
